column4: ubuntu 10.10 server.  lspci shows my wireless card Intel Corpcan  PRO/Wireless 4965 AG or AGN [kendron] Network Connection- but im unable to get it to work.  Can someone please help me?
i see some people saying when they dual boot with windows- it works.  but im not running windows at all.
the other docs i see all show how i can setup wireless using gnome. but i have  only commandline.
man iwconfig, man iwlist, do you have driver already working?
no, it's not an open connection
You need to know wpa_supplicant, hm WPA2, do not recall perfect solution...
anyway to confirm your wireless works: iwlist wlan0 scanning
that returns a result.    i found my essid.  now im trying to iwconfig wlan0 key my_key_here but it's throwing an invalid arg on my_key_here
You need wpa_supplicant to connect (and there is plenty on almost good how-tos, it may be that you will need wicd)
scp? Depense which side and are you behind router.
are you - from local machine: scp <local file> remote.host:/path/to/new/file/ if not how you do it?
